goal.ch:
"By the end of the course, participants will be able to:
1. Be aware of the importance of collaborative knowledge creation and Innovation in modern society; be aware of the need in education for collaborative knowledge creation and Innovation; appreciate knowledge creation works and recognize themselves as knowledge creation works
2. Have sufficient understanding of Knowledge Building and how it has been applied in education for knowledge creation and innovation
3. Actively engage in Knowledge Building communities and cultivate their literacy as a knowledge creator and innovator
4. Collaboratively design prototypes for technology-supported future learning focus on Knowledge Building in various educational contexts"

outline.ch:
"Week 1 1. Course Introduction
Week 2 1. Introducing basic functions in KF (0.5 hour)
2. Experiencing co-design activity on KF (1 hour): Designing classroom for learning in the future
3. Group to whole class discussion on KF (1 hour)
4. Further exploration activity (0.5 hour)
5. After class activity
Week 3 1. Oral group report (1) (0.5 hour)
2. Provide Feedbacks by group on KF (0.5 hour)
3. Redesign (1 hour)
4. Group to whole class discussion (1 hour)
5. After class activity
Week 4 1. Oral group report (2) (0.5 hour)
2. Provide feedbacks individually on KF (0.5 hour)
3. Reflection (0.5 hour)
4. Introduction to Knowledge Building (2 hour)
5. After class
Reflection on their Knowledge Building practice during design process
Week 5 Discussion and reflection on Knowledge Building and Knowledge Building practice
After class
Week 6 1. Assessment in Knowledge Building
2. Assessments tools in KF
After class
Week 7 Empirical Knowledge Building cases (KB Gallery + online resources + journal papers)
After class
Week 8-11 (4 weeks) Co-design activity
After class
Week 12 Design report
Week 13-16 Re-design activity
After class
Week 17 Group final report and reflection
Week 18 Individual reflection and conclusion"

gradMethod.ch:
"Course Evaluation
1. Process:
a. Participation (10%): 
Classroom participation (5%)
online community participation (5%; writing and reading notes)
b. Individual self-reflection (5 reflection notes on week 2, 4, 6, 11, and 16 + final report on week 18) (30%): 
● Understanding regarding collaborative knowledge creation and innovation and KB theory
● Sense of community or community identity
● How did you work with ideas? 
● How did you contribute to the community?
● How did you co-work with my peers?
   c.  Collective reflection on Community KB practice (5 reflection notes on week 2, 4, 6, 11, and 16 + final report on week 17) (40%): 
based on KB principles and the CTL 1603- Course Syllabus
● Are your ideas advanced? If yes, what was the original idea? What is the refined idea? How did it grow? What is the evidence of advance? How did you advance your ideas? Please provide detailed description and examples. If not, why? How will you advance the idea(s) further?
● Did you evaluate the promisingness of your ideas or design? If yes, how did you do and what are your evaluative standards?
● Do you have your community goal and community norms (i.e., the set of behaviors expected in your community)? If yes, did you achieve your community goal? Did most of you work with the community norms? Did the community norms help you advance your ideas? Did you want to modify your community goals and community norms? If not, please discuss on and write down your community goals and your community norms.
2. Outcomes:
Prototype design for technology-supported future learning focus on Knowledge Building: (20%) (peer evaluation and expert evaluation)"

en.competencies: Understand the developing history and trend of network learning.
Develop the theoretical accomplishment of network learning.
Develop the needed technological ability of network learning.
Develop the research methodology of network learning and the ability to  promote and put network learning in use.
Develop the ability to coordinate and make innovative design.
Develop multi-disciplined  talents with international perspective.
